actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Rules.
Reported to House from the Committee on Rules with amendment, H. Rept. 94-12.
Measure called up by special rule in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #18 (286-120).

official_title: Resolution establishing a Select Committee on Intelligence.

summary.text: (Establishes the House Select Committee on Intelligence to investigate the organization, operation, and oversight of the intelligence community of the United States Government, to be composed of 10 members appointed by the Speaker.) Directs the select committee to inquire into: (1) the collection, analysis, use, and cost of intelligence information and allegations of improper activities of intelligence agencies in the United States and abroad; (2) the need for improved or reorganized oversight by the Congress of intelligence activities; and (3) procedures for and means of the protection of rights and privileges of citizens from illegal or improper intelligence activities. Lists executive departments and agencies which the select committee is authorized to investigate. Grants subpena power to the select committee. Requires the select committee to establish rules and procedures to prevent unauthorized disclosure of information and testimony taken in executive session or obtained by other means. Requires it to report to the House by January 31, 1976.

titles.title: Resolution establishing a Select Committee on Intelligence.
